alert.note: Alert for Essex; King William; King and Queen; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 2:31PM EDT until July 29 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern King and Queen County in east central Virginia... Central Richmond County in east central Virginia... Southeastern Westmoreland County in east central Virginia... Central King William County in east central Virginia... Essex County in east central Virginia... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 231 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Champlain to Manquin, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Tappahannock around 245 PM EDT. Stevensville around 255 PM EDT. Warsaw and Millers Tavern around 300 PM EDT. Haynesville around 310 PM EDT. Center Cross, Hague, Dunnsville and Sharps around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Threeway, Upright, Ino, Biscoe, Tidewater, Lyells, Crouch, Kennard, Mount Landing and Piney Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Essex; King William; King and Queen; Richmond; Westmoreland
